item.title: Second Post
item.author: Daniel
item.description: When starting a blog Last time I truly hosted a public site was in the early 2010s when learning about the new trend of responsive web design with the growth of mobile web browsing. Between then and now Why a static website Why static websit GitHub Actions Although I’ve setup pipelines on AWS

item.title: About
item.author: Daniel
item.description: Hi there, I’m Daniel ðŸ‘‹ About I’m an engineer located in Toronto, Canada and I work specifically in the field of platform engineering and cloud infrastructure. I always loved working with electronics and tweaking my PC for optimal performance as a hobby and this led me to a career focusing on networking, infrastructure and development. The idea of learning in public peaked my interest since I’ve always been dabbling and trying new things and taking notes so this helps to formalize and share them.

item.title: Intro
item.author: Daniel
item.description: Intro This is a personal page that I created to try my hand at blogging and technical writing. I like to tinker with tech and always had an interest in pushing the potential of older computers. I’m hoping to share share my experiences, side projects in tech that I’ve found fun and interesting. Although I’ve created pages for internal clients during my day job, it is nice to build something to share.
